question: Will Donald Trump attend the Super Bowl in 2025?
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Donald Trump to Attend Super Bowl 2025, a Contrasting Figure in the NFL**
Donald Trump, the newly elected President of the United States, will be attending the Super Bowl 2025 at the Caesar's Super Dome. According to an official White House spokesperson, Trump will have a private box to watch the rematch between the Chiefs and the Eagles on February 9th. This move is seen as a contrast to the NFL's efforts to promote social inclusion, diversity, and interculturalism. The spokesperson stated that Trump is a big fan of the game and wants to be a part of the event that brings people together in the US.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 05, 2025 11:33 PM
Source:[Medio Tiempo](https://www.mediotiempo.com/futbol-americano/nfl/donald-trump-ira-al-super-bowl-2025-y-la-nfl-decide-retirar-mensajes-anti-racismo)

**Donald Trump to Attend Super Bowl 2025, Enhanced Security Measures in Place**
Donald Trump will be the first US President to attend the Super Bowl live, as confirmed by the Secret Service. The President, a self-proclaimed fan of the Kansas City Chiefs, will attend the game between the Philadelphia Eagles and the Chiefs on February 9th in New Orleans. According to the Secret Service, 'extensive planning and coordination have been carried out to ensure the safety of all attendees, players, and staff.' The security measures have been enhanced this year due to Trump's attendance, as stated in a press release. Trump has expressed his support for the Chiefs in the past, saying, 'Congratulations. What a great team, coach, quarterback, and almost everything else, including those fantastic fans. Congratulations to the Buffalo Bills for a tremendous season. They're going to win a lot in the future!!!' When asked about the likely winner of the Super Bowl, Trump replied, 'I don't want to say, but there's a certain quarterback who seems like a good winner,' which is believed to be a reference to Patrick Mahomes. The increased security is also due to the recent attack in New Orleans on January 1st, where a man ran over dozens of people, killing 14.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 05, 2025 04:46 PM
Source:[FanSided](https://fansided.com/es/donald-trump-primer-presidente-estados-unidos-asistir-super-bowl)

**Donald Trump to Become First US President to Attend Super Bowl**
US President Donald Trump will attend Super Bowl 2025 in New Orleans on February 10 between the 'Kansas City Chiefs' and 'Philadelphia Eagles', according to CNN. Trump will become the first sitting US President to attend the NFL championship game. Due to Trump's planned visit, organizers have tightened security requirements. The event staff will be significantly reduced for security checks, and many participants have been told not to attend the stadium before the Super Bowl. A source described the preparation as 'very serious' and 'quite intense', comparing the level of checks to a G7 summit.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 05, 2025 08:45 AM
Source:[championat.com](https://www.championat.com/other/news-5889642-donald-tramp-stanet-pervym-prezidentom-ssha-kotoryj-posetit-superboul.html)

**Trump to Attend Super Bowl 2025: A Historic First for a Sitting US President**
US President Donald Trump will attend Super Bowl 2025 between 'Kansas City' and 'Philadelphia'. The game, scheduled for February 10 in New Orleans, is expected to draw over 100,000 fans. In light of the recent terrorist attack in New Orleans, which killed 14 people, the authorities have taken unprecedented security measures, classifying the event as a 'level 1' threat. The total amount of bets placed on the Super Bowl in the US this year has reached a record $23 billion, a $7 billion increase from last year. As Trump will be the first sitting US President to attend the Super Bowl, the event is expected to be heavily secured, with around 700 security personnel deployed. Trump plans to attend the game in person, saying, 'It will be a great day.' 
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 05, 2025 08:42 AM
Source:[Спорт Mail.ru](https://sportmail.ru/article/american-football/64741509/)

**Trump to Attend Super Bowl 2025, a First for an Active US President**
According to a source, the Super Bowl 2025 will see a significant reduction in staff on Friday and Saturday at the stadium for security checks, with many personnel told not to attend both days. The source described the preparations as 'very serious' and 'fairly intense', comparing the on-site checks to those at a G7 summit. Donald Trump is set to become the first incumbent US President to attend the NFL Super Bowl final.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 05, 2025 06:25 AM
Source:[Sports.ru](https://www.sports.ru/amfootball/1116624680-tramp-posetit-superboul-2025-on-stanet-pervym-prezidentom-ssha-kotoryj.html)

**Trump to Attend Super Bowl 2025, Breaking Presidential Tradition**
Donald Trump, the upcoming incumbent President of the United States, will attend the Super Bowl 2025 in person, according to the White House. He will be present in New Orleans to witness the final game of the American football season between the Kansas City Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles. Trump will be the first President to attend the event during his term, despite having a history of difficult relationships with the NFL. In 2017, he criticized NFL players who knelt during the national anthem to draw attention to racial injustice, sparking a wave of protests from players. As the President said, 'I will be attending the Super Bowl to show my support for the American people and the great sport of football.' 
Original language: fr
Publish date: February 05, 2025 01:42 AM
Source:[20minutes](https://www.20minutes.fr/sport/nfl/4137158-20250205-football-americain-donald-trump-premier-president-americain-exercice-tribunes-super-bowl)

**Donald Trump to Attend Super Bowl 2025, Breaking Presidential Tradition**
Donald Trump, the incumbent US President, will attend the Super Bowl 2025 in New Orleans, marking the first time a sitting President has attended the event. The Super Bowl will feature the Kansas City Chiefs against the Philadelphia Eagles. Trump's attendance comes despite his complicated history with the NFL, including his criticism of players who knelt during the national anthem in 2017 to protest racial injustice. According to the White House, Trump said, 'I am looking forward to attending the Super Bowl and cheering on the Chiefs.' Trump's presence at the event has sparked controversy, with some players and fans expressing concerns about his attendance.
Original language: fr
Publish date: February 05, 2025 01:34 AM
Source:[Yahoo actualités](https://fr.news.yahoo.com/sport/football-am%C3%A9ricain-donald-trump-premier-013435125.html)

**Donald Trump to Attend Super Bowl 2025, Makes Prediction**
US President Donald Trump is set to attend Super Bowl 2025, the biggest sporting event in the US, and will give an interview to Fox News before the game. This will be the first time a sitting president has attended the event. Trump was asked about his prediction for the game, which will feature the Kansas City Chiefs against the Philadelphia Eagles. 'I don't want to say, but there's a certain 'quarterback' who seems like a great winner,' he said, apparently referring to Patrick Mahomes. The game will take place a month after a terrorist attack in New Orleans that killed 14 people and injured dozens. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem has assured that her agency has protected the event for over 20 years and is working 'around the clock' to ensure security at the Superdome in New Orleans. Noem also stated that her agency has not received any 'credible threats' to the game and has deployed 'resources in advance' to the city. The attack occurred on New Year's Eve when a 42-year-old man drove a van into a crowd on Bourbon Street, killing at least 14 people before being shot by police.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 04, 2025 10:36 PM
Source:[MVS Noticias](https://mvsnoticias.com/deportes/2025/2/4/super-bowl-2025-donald-trump-asistira-al-partido-a-quien-le-va-677082.html)

**Trump to Revive Presidential Super Bowl Tradition That Biden Scrapped**
President Donald Trump has revived a Super Bowl tradition that was previously scrapped by President Joe Biden. Trump will sit for an interview with Bret Baier, an anchor from the host network Fox, during the pregame show. The interview, which has already been pre-taped, will air at 3:00 p.m. ET on Sunday, Feb. 9. Baier asked Trump about his policies, including tariffs imposed on Canada, Mexico, and China, and the handling of fentanyl and illegal immigration. This tradition, which dates back to 2004, was previously skipped by Trump in 2018 and by Biden in 2023 and 2024. Trump was also interviewed by Sean Hannity two days after his return to the Oval Office, where he discussed topics such as Biden's pardons and the aftermath of assassination attempts against him. Trump said, 'We can get our country back. But if we didn't win this race, I really believe our country would have been lost forever.'
Original language: en
Publish date: February 03, 2025 10:50 PM
Source:[The Western Journal](https://www.westernjournal.com/trump-revive-presidential-super-bowl-tradition-biden-scrapped/)

**Here's what you need to know about 2025 Super Bowl security in New Orleans - Washington Examiner**
The 2025 Super Bowl in New Orleans is expected to have increased security following a deadly New Year's Eve attack. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem and NFL Chief Security Officer Cathy Lanier have urged attendees to speak up if they see something suspicious. The Caesars Superdome will open at 1:30 p.m. and attendees are advised to bring minimal items, with clear bags being the only allowed type. 2,000 law enforcement officers and 350 National Guard troops will be on patrol. Gov. Jeff Landry defended the decision to allow concealed carry in security enhancement zones, citing statistics that show areas with concealed carry are safer. Firearms are prohibited in the Superdome, and bringing drones could result in a fine of up to $7,500. The game will feature the Kansas City Chiefs against the Philadelphia Eagles, with the Chiefs aiming to become the first team to win three Super Bowl games in a row. President Donald Trump will conduct an interview with Fox News host Bret Baier as part of the Super Bowl pregame show.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 03, 2025 08:24 PM
Source:[Washington Examiner](https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/3308989/what-to-know-2025-super-bowl-security-new-orleans/)

**Will the Super Bowl 2025 See a Guacamole Shortage Due to Trump's Tariffs?**
The upcoming Super Bowl 2025 may see a shortage of guacamole due to the tariffs imposed by Donald Trump on Mexican avocado imports. The 25% tariff on various products, including avocados, could increase the price of guacamole or even make it scarce. According to the National Agricultural Council (CNA), the new tariffs will affect Mexican exports worth over $475 billion, representing 80% of the country's shipments to the US. Products like avocados, tomatoes, chilies, and berries, which account for over 50% of Mexico's exports, may see a significant price increase for US consumers. The meat sector will also be affected, as Mexico exports around $1.5 billion worth of beef and pork to the US. Meanwhile, Mexican avocado producers are looking to diversify their markets, with the Association of Avocado Producers and Exporters of Jalisco (Apeajal) planning to strengthen exports to Asia and South America. Despite the uncertainty, avocado producers in Michoacán and Jalisco, the only states authorized to export to the US, expect to send 110,000 tons to meet the demand for the Super Bowl 2025, similar to the amount sent in 2024. However, the entry into force of the tariffs could alter the distribution and price of the product in the US market. 'It is a challenge for us, but we are working to improve our processes, implement sustainable practices, and increase the cultivated area to ensure the supply at a global level,' said an avocado producer. 'We are not going to let this affect us, we will find a way to continue exporting and providing the best quality avocados to our customers.' 
Original language: es
Publish date: February 03, 2025 01:17 PM
Source:[MVS Noticias](https://mvsnoticias.com/mundo/2025/2/3/sin-guacamole-para-el-super-bowl-2025-asi-afectaran-los-aranceles-de-trump-al-aguacate-en-eu-676823.html)

**President Trump to Sit for Super Bowl Interview With Fox News Anchor Bret Baier**
President Donald Trump will sit down for a pre-recorded interview with Fox News anchor Bret Baier ahead of Super Bowl LIX. The interview, which will air during the 3 p.m. hour of the Fox pregame show and on Baier's Special Report on Monday, will focus on the changes enacted by the Trump administration since his inauguration and the first 100 days of his presidency. This marks a modern tradition for the President to reach a wide audience before the Super Bowl. Baier last interviewed Trump one-on-one in June 2023, and Fox says the interview will be pre-taped at Trump's Mar-a-Lago club in West Palm Beach.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 03, 2025 01:00 PM
Source:[The Hollywood Reporter](https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/trump-super-bowl-interview-fox-news-bret-baier-1236125903/)

**JUST IN: Bret Baier to Interview Trump at Mar-a-Lago for Super Bowl Pregame Show**
Fox News' Bret Baier will interview President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago for the network's Super Bowl LIX pregame show, airing on February 9. The conversation will focus on the administration's early policies and the political landscape heading into 2025. This marks Baier's first one-on-one interview with Trump since June 2023, and comes as the president approaches the 100-day milestone of his return to the White House. Baier has a history of interviewing Trump, including a town hall meeting and moderating key debates, and has also interviewed Vice President Kamala Harris. As Baier said, 'The conversation will provide a platform for Trump to share his views on the administration's early policies and the political landscape heading into 2025.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: February 03, 2025 12:20 PM
Source:[mediaite.com](https://www.mediaite.com/news/just-in-bret-baier-to-interview-trump-at-mar-a-lago-for-super-bowl-pregame-show/)

**AP Finds a Way to Blame the High Cost of Americans' Super Bowl Party Spread... on Donald Trump**
The Associated Press (AP) published an article claiming that the high cost of Super Bowl party food in 2025 is due to the Trump administration's tariff policy. However, the article's thesis is strained and based on a flawed analysis. Economists from the Wells Fargo Agri-Food Institute found that the price of a Super Bowl party menu for 10 people has only increased by 0.1% from last year, with broccoli and celery being cheaper options. The AP failed to mention the mass culling of poultry due to bird flu concerns, which has likely contributed to the increase in chicken wing prices. The article's attempt to blame the Trump administration's tariff policy for the high food prices is 'totally ridiculous' and a 'creative new angle to pin former President Joe Biden's failures on Donald Trump's nascent term'.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 02, 2025 03:21 AM
Source:[Redstate](https://redstate.com/beccalower/2025/02/01/leave-it-to-the-ap-to-find-a-way-to-blame-the-high-cost-of-americans-super-bowl-parties-on-trump-n2185096)

**Super Bowl 2025: Chiefs vs Eagles, Kendrick Lamar to Perform at Halftime**
The Kansas City Chiefs, led by quarterback Patrick Mahomes, will face the Philadelphia Eagles in Super Bowl 2025. This will be the Chiefs' third consecutive Super Bowl appearance. The game will take place on February 9th at the Caesars Superdome in New Orleans. The Super Bowl will start at 5:30 PM local time, with a pre-game ceremony and a performance by Jon Batiste. The halftime show will feature rapper Kendrick Lamar, who will perform his second Super Bowl show, and his first solo performance. The game is expected to be closely watched, not only for the football, but also for potential protests against the return of Donald Trump to the US presidency. The romance between Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, a tight end for the Chiefs, is also expected to draw attention. The Chiefs are currently favored to win, with a 1.5-point lead over the Eagles. Patrick Mahomes is expected to be the MVP of the game, followed by Saquon Barkley of the Eagles.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 29, 2025 04:31 AM
Source:[EL PAÍS](https://elpais.com/mexico/2025-01-29/super-bowl-2025-horario-show-de-medio-tiempo-y-donde-ver-la-final-entre-philadelphia-eagles-y-kansas-city-chiefs-en-mexico.html)

**The Guacamole Tradition in Danger: Will Donald Trump's Tariffs End the Super Bowl Snack?**
The tradition of enjoying guacamole during the Super Bowl may come to an end due to the increase in tariffs announced by Donald Trump on Mexican products. The export of avocados to the US for the 2025 Super Bowl is projected to be 110,000 tons, but the 25% tariff increase could disrupt this. The Secretary of Fomento Agroalimentario and Desarrollo Rural (Sefader) of Oaxaca, Víctor López Leyva, said that Oaxaca and Michoacán could benefit from the sale of avocados and Persian limes in February for the preparation of guacamole in the Super Bowl LIX. However, the subsecretary of Agronegocios, Fernando Robles, commented that, according to the regulations, agricultural products are exempt from tariffs and dumping, including tomatoes and avocados. 'We cannot promise the NFL fans that there will be guacamole for the Super Bowl LIX due to the diplomatic tensions between the two countries,' said López Leyva. 'The increase in tariffs announced by Trump could change the situation,' he added. 'We are in a delicate situation, and we do not know what will happen,' said Robles. 'The tradition of enjoying guacamole during the Super Bowl is in danger,' said López Leyva. 'It's a tradition that has been going on for over 13 years, and it's a shame that it could come to an end,' he added.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 25, 2025 04:30 PM
Source:[MVS Noticias](https://mvsnoticias.com/deportes/2025/1/25/donald-trump-sus-aranceles-el-fin-del-guacamole-en-el-super-bowl-675655.html)

**Trump to visit L.A. and an NFL playoffs preview: Morning Rundown**
President Donald Trump's executive order targeting diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives has left federal workers feeling angry and fearful. **Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl 2025 Halftime Show: What to Expect**
The Super Bowl 2025 halftime show, headlined by Kendrick Lamar, is generating a lot of buzz and speculation. According to MyTopSportsbooks, a website specializing in sports betting analysis, the predictions for the show go beyond music and include aspects such as surprise elements. Fans are speculating about what surprises Lamar might bring to his performance, given his previous appearance at the Super Bowl in 2022. Some of the most popular bets include whether Lamar will mention any political or social topics, such as the recent inauguration of Donald Trump as President of the United States. Lamar has been known for his socially conscious lyrics, and his song 'The Heart Part 4' even referred to Trump as a 'fool.' The halftime show has come a long way since its transformation in 1991, when New Kids on the Block and Gloria Estefan marked the beginning of a new era by incorporating pop culture elements. Michael Jackson's memorable performance in 1993 set a new standard for future shows. Lamar's return to the Super Bowl stage in 2025 is generating even more expectations about how he might surpass or reinvent his previous performance.

Publish date: January 20, 2025 09:52 PM

**Southwest Floridians embrace D.C. inauguration despite changes**
Thousands of people, including many from Southwest Florida, have gathered in Washington, D.C. for Donald Trump's inauguration. Despite the ceremony moving indoors, the atmosphere remains high. Scott Verdonck, a Southwest Floridian, compared the event to the Super Bowl, saying, 'This is like the Super Bowl for us.' Many attendees, including Marta Evans from Bonita Springs and Jim Boatman from Naples, are determined to be part of the historic moment, with some even braving the cold without tickets. The Capital One Arena will host parades and screenings for up to 20,000 people on a first-come, first-served basis.

**Trump To Hold Massive MAGA ‘Victory Rally’ In D.C. Before Inauguration**
President-elect Donald Trump will host a 'Make America Great Again Rally' at the Capital One Arena in Washington D.C. on January 19, 2025, the day before his inauguration for a second term. The rally, which is expected to draw around 20,000 attendees, will be held at 3 p.m. ET. Trump is set to be sworn into office the next day, January 20, 2025, marking the 60th U.S. presidential inauguration. U.S. Capitol Police Chief Tom Manger has stated that security for the event will be 'night and day' from what it was four years ago, with fences already erected around the Capitol to warn potential trespassers. The Department of Homeland Security has designated the certification of presidential electors on January 6 as a National Special Security Event, providing the same level of protection as inaugurations and the Super Bowl.

**Super Bowl LIX, a $7.5 billion plant decision and Trader Joe's, here are potential business headlines for 2025**
Several major business developments are expected in Louisiana in 2025, including the opening of two new casinos, a $7.5 billion ammonia plant, and a new Trader Joe's store. The Super Bowl will also be held in New Orleans, with a projected $500 million economic impact. President-elect Donald Trump is promising to boost oil and gas production, which could have implications for the state. Ochsner is set to break ground on a new children's hospital, and First Solar will begin manufacturing at its Iberia Parish plant. The Four Seasons redevelopment has been a financial disaster for investors, with lenders finalizing a deal to wipe out equity investors.
